column4: This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.
column6: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.
column8: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
column10: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”

column4: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.
column6: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

column4: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
column6: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
column8: The overwhelming power that fills its entire body causes it to turn black and creates intense blue flames.
column10: The overwhelming power that fills its entire body causes it to turn black and creates intense blue flames.
column12: Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet fighter.
column14: Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet fighter.
column16: This colossal, flame-winged figure of a Charizard was brought about by Gigantamax energy.
